intro: Camelina alyssum subsp. alyssum, commonly known as yellow rocket, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and slender, branching stems. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is native to Europe and parts of Asia. It has small, elongated leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing several seeds. Camelina alyssum subsp. alyssum is often found in meadows, roadsides, and other open habitats.
